key_points: Ransomware intrusion affected Bose's IT systems and exposed personal data of six former employees.
The cyberattack occurred in March, with Bose detecting the potential data exfiltration in late April.
Exposed data includes Social Security numbers and salary information of former employees based in New Hampshire.
As of May 19, there was no evidence found of the exposed data being sold on the dark web.
The incident highlights the ongoing national issue with ransomware attacks affecting various sectors.
Bose did not pay a ransom and has not disclosed the type of ransomware used.
Bose reported $3.6 billion in sales last year and assures no ongoing disruption to its business.
The company has worked to safely restore its systems with the help of cyber experts.
Bose is offering a year of free anti-fraud service to the affected individuals.
Consumer advocates urge for more protections for victims of data breaches.
